description.narrative: To support the Conditional Cash Transfer Program coverage expansion, strengthen the Social Registry and delivery systems of the Conditional Cash Transfer Program and the Social and Economic Empowerment Program, and improve the coordination between these programs and other complementary social programs

condition.narrative: The Borrower shall appoint BPKP to act as an independent verification agent to undertake the DLR verification process referred toin Section I.B.2 of Schedule 2 of the Loan Agreement in respect of all DLRs for the Program, in accordance with the terms ofreference acceptable to the Bank (Section I.B.1 of Schedule 2 to the Loan Agreement).

title.narrative: Share of sub-districts with PKH beneficiary families having switched to cashless payment methods
Share of PKH beneficiary families, for which verification of their respective conditionality is recorded in e-PKH
Ratio of number of PKH beneficiary families to number of the targeted families in areas categorized by the Ministry of Social Affairs as remote and border areas
Number of PKH beneficiary families that also receive benefits for severely disabled or elderly family members
Total number of PKH beneficiary families
Share of PKH beneficiaries whose NIK numbers have been verified
Number of PKH mother groups that have received FDS from trained facilitators
Share of children aged 0–6 years in PKH beneficiary families who received basic health and nutrition services in accordance with protocol
Share of children aged 7–18 years in PKH beneficiary families attending primary, junior, and senior secondary school at least 85% of the time
PKH uses digital platforms and mass media to regularly disclose information about program performance and the program manages to carry out social promotion

target.value: Communication through digital platform and mass media regularly disclosed at subnational level

actual.value: Communication through digital platforms and mass media has been implemented at the Subnational Level

target.value: Additional enhancements recommended by the IT system audit on e-PKH implemented

title.narrative: An enhanced GRS rolled out after evaluation of pilot

target.value: Grievance analysis produced using data collected by the enhanced GRS rolled out nationwide

actual.value: GRS SoPs developed based on pilot analysis, the enhanced GRS rolled-out (with additional toll-free channels). GRS 2020 report hasbeen produced.

title.narrative: Production of operation monitoring statistical reports for all districts regularly generated and disclosed to related stakeholders

target.value: Operation monitoring report disclosed after further modification

actual.value: Monitoring report on PKH implementation already exists, but cannot be accessed openly

title.narrative: Error, fraud, and corruption detection systems implemented

target.value: MoSA has implemented measures, including data standards and data consistency checks, to detect and prevent errors. Additionalmeasures, including GRS and follow-up investigation, to detect and deter frauds and corruption.

actual.value: PKH HR Code of Ethics has been mandated and Ethics Commission has been established to address fraud and corruption related issues.The Code of Ethics has been socialized and implemented.

title.narrative: Share of PKH beneficiary families with at least one member receiving health insurance premium fee waiver (PBI-JKN)
Share of PKH beneficiary families receiving food assistance benefits (Rastra/BPNT/Sembako)
Share of new SE program recipients that are former PKH recipients

target.value: At least 98% of new SE program recipients in 2023 are PKH Graduates

title.narrative: DTKS increasingly uses information from relevant internal and external databases for DTKS data updating and develops improved data use environments and dissemination channels

baseline.value: 2 External databases are interoperable with DTKS; no Middleware and Business Intelligence systems, dedicated help desk oranalytical tool is in place

target.value: 11 internal or external databases are interoperable with DTKS; local governments and central government stakeholders can benefitfrom DTKS' Middleware and Business Intelligence systems, a dedicated help desk and DTKS analytical tool

actual.value: 3 External databases are interoperable with DTKS; Middleware and Business Intelligence systems developed; SIKS-NG help desk andanalytical tool in place

title.narrative: Share of 0–6 years girls in the PKH families who received basic health and nutrition services in accordance with protocol
Share of 7–18 years girls in PKH families attending primary, junior, and senior secondary school at least 85% of the time
Share of PKH beneficiaries having had their socio-economic status re-assessed during the past two years

target.value: 80% of PKH beneficiaries having had their socio-economic status re-assessed during the past two years

title.narrative: Share of local governments that are submitting updated data that meets DTKS standards

baseline.value: Basic data updating standards in place

target.value: 80% of local governments submitting updated data that meets MoSA’s enhanced standards

actual.value: Basic data updating standards in place, but have not been disseminated to local governments.

title.narrative: MoSA establishes a disaster victim database to support better disaster response

baseline.value: Disaster victim related data not digitized and linked with DTKS

target.value: The disaster victims' support information management system is utilized in response to at least one disaster

actual.value: Disaster victim related data not digitized and linked with DTKS

title.narrative: Share of PKH mother groups that have been provided the relevant FDS per their choices

baseline.value: Five Modules (health, education, child protection, household economy, elderly and disability care) not in place

target.value: 60% of PKH mother groups have been provided the relevant FDS per their choices by trained facilitators

actual.value: Four new FDS modules have been developed through the Family Development sessions named ‘Modul Keluarga Sejahtera Mandiri - KSM’(Welfare and Self-Sufficient Family Module).

title.narrative: Share of non-civil servant HR contracted by MoSA for PKH implementation with their KPIs having been monitored quarterly

baseline.value: JSK has less than 50 civil servants and more than 60 contracted consultants. 40,000+ contracted workers for implementation arerecruited

target.value: 70% of non-civil servant HR contracted by MoSA for PKH implementation with their KPIs having been monitored quarterly within thecalendar year.

actual.value: JSK has less than 50 civil servants and more than 60 contracted consultants. 19,000+ contracted workers for implementation arerecruited with limited performance management practices. An assessment of PKH human resources with recommendations for DLR 14.1 wasalso completed and approved.

title.narrative: Monitoring system for SE program is operational

target.value: (i) Routine reports generated and (ii) linkages with SIKS-NG operational

title.narrative: Share of new SE program recipients that are women
PKH introduces a temporary emergency cash transfer scheme in response to COVID-19 and other large- scale shocks

target.value: MoSA issues a guideline regarding the PKH temporary emergency scheme for future large-scale natural disasters and epidemic shocks,after assessing the scheme's implementation experience in 2020
